{{hatnote|Africanization can also refer to [[Africanized bee|Africanized "killer" bees]].}} '''Africanization''' or '''Africanisation''' (lit., making something African) has been applied in various contexts, notably in geographic and personal naming and in the composition of the civil service e.g. via processes such as [[indigenization]].African Successes Four Public Managers of Kenyan Rural Development David K. Leonard UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA PRESS ==Africanization of names== Africanization has referred to the modification of place names and personal names to reflect an "African" identity. In some cases, changes are not a change of transliteration rather than of the European name.{{cite book|title=Language in Africa: An Introductory Survey|author=Edgar A. Gregersen|year= 1977|publisher=CRC Press|isbn=0-677-04380-5}} In many cases during the colonial period, African place names were [[Anglicisation|Anglicized]] or [[Francization|Francized]]. ===Place names=== ====Country names==== Various African countries have undergone name changes during the previous century as the result of consolidations and [[secession]]s, territories gaining [[sovereignty]], and [[regime change]]s. {|class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size: 90%" |- ! Previous name !! Year !! [[Djibouti]], Republic of |- | [[Spanish Guinea]] | 1968 | [[Equatorial Guinea]], Republic of |- | [[Swaziland]], Kingdom of | 2018 | [[Swaziland|Eswatini]], Kingdom of |- | [[Gold Coast (British [[Namibia]], Republic of |- | [[Ruanda-Urundi]] | 1962 | [[Rwanda]], Republic of / [[Burundi]], Republic of |- | [[Zanzibar]] / [[Tanganyika]] | 1964 | [[Tanzania]], United Republic of |- | [[Buganda]] | 1962 | [[Uganda]], Republic of |- | [[Northern Rhodesia]] | 1964 | [[Zambia]], Republic of |- | [[Southern Rhodesia]] | 1980 | [[Zimbabwe]], Republic of |} ====Other place names==== *Fernando Po island changed to [[Bioko]] Island *Léopoldville changed to [[Kinshasa]] *Salisbury changed to [[Harare]] *Lourenço Marques changed to [[Maputo]] *Nova Lisboa changed to [[Huambo]] *Fort Lamy changed to [[N'Djaména]] *Tananarive changed to [[Antananarivo]] *Bathurst changed to [[Banjul]] *Santa Isabel/ Port Clarence changed to [[Malabo]] *Élisabethville changed to [[Lubumbashi]] *Stanleyville changed to [[Kisangani]] *Luluabourg changed to [[Kananga]] *Ponthierville changed to [[Ubundu]] *Novo Redondo changed to [[Sumbe]] *Moçâmedes changed to Namibe, but changed back to [[Moçâmedes]] in 2016 *Abercorn changed to [[Mbala, Zambia|Mbala]] *Broken Hill changed to [[Kabwe]] *Fort Jameson changed to [[Chipata]] *Hartley changed to [[Chegutu]] *Fort Victoria changed to [[Masvingo]] *Many places whose names were of European origin in South Africa have undergone Africanization since 1994; see [[South African Geographical Names Council]]. ===Personal names=== *Joseph-Désiré Mobutu changed to [[Mobutu Sese Seko]] *François Tombalbaye changed to [[N'Garta Tombalbaye]] *Étienne Eyadéma changed to [[Gnassingbé Eyadéma]] *[[Francisco Macías Nguema]] changed to Masie Nguema Biyogo Ñegue Ndong Other name changes take place when an African person converts to or from [[Islam]] or another religion. (See [[Islamic name]].)
Examples: *Albert-Bernard Bongo changed to [[Omar Bongo]] *[[Dawda Jawara]] changed to David Jawara in 1953 *[[Jean-Bédel Bokassa]] changed to Salah Eddine Ahmed Bokassa ==Africanization of civil services== In some countries immediately following their independence, "Africanization" was the name given to [[racial]] policies, [[affirmative action]] intended to increase the number of Africans in [[civil service]] (which had historically been dominated by whites[https://books.google.com/books?id=ffkFRTj1WIwC&pg=PA406&lpg=PA406&dq=Africanization+of+civil+service&source=web&ots=988fWraWRf&sig=gMOO4OWQKqoqnhUwqSOjMnRiK2o&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=8&ct=result Adedeji, Adebayo. "Comparative strategies of economic decolonization of Africa." In Ali AlʼAmin Mazrui and Christophe Wondji, eds. ''Africa Since 1935''. UNESCO] or Asians.Pp.176-178. Goans of the North Atlantic: A Transnational Study of Migration, Technology Adoption, and Neoculturation across Six Generations by Clifford Pereira in Migration, technology and Transculturation: Global Perspective. Edited by Myna German and Padmini Banerjee. Center for International and Global Studies. Lindenwood University Press. St. Charles. Mo. USA) ==Localization in African languages== The term Africanization, abbreviated as the [[numeronym]] "A12n," has been applied to discussion of [[internationalization and localization]] of software and content in [[African languages]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} == See also == *[[List of placename renaming in South Africa]] *[[List of city name changes]] *[[List of renamed places in Namibia]] *[[List of placename renaming in Zimbabwe]] *[[Former place names in the Democratic Republic of the Congo]] {{Portal|Africa}} {{Pan-Africanism}} {{Cultural assimilation|sp=ize}} [[Category:African culture]] [[Category:Decolonisation]] [[Category:Cultural assimilation]] [[Category:Geographical naming disputes]] [[Category:Names of places in Africa]] [[Category:Anti-Western sentiment]] [[Category:Pan-Africanism]] [[Category:Human names]]

{{Multiple issues|{{unreferenced|date=April 2015}}{{POV|date=April 2015}}}}
[[File:Roussillon - Carte de Nicolas de Fer (1706).jpg|thumb|Map of the province of Roussillon by Nicolas de Fer (1706)]]
The '''Angelets''', or “the Angelets of the Earth” (in Catalan, ''“els Angelets de la Terra”''), were peasants who rose up from 1667 to 1675 against the French authorities of the [[Roussillon]] province. The group of conflicts of the period is subsumed under the name of “the '''Revolt of the Angelets'''”. The cause was the instituting of the [[gabelle]] (salt tax) in 1661 — a measure contrary to traditional constitutions of the earldom (the earldom of Roussillon and [[Cerdanya]], the lands of the crown of [[Majorca]] from 1276 to 1344).
The revolt first concerned the county of [[Vallespir]], then it won those of [[Conflent]] and Roussillon.
== The name ==
[[File:Guido Reni 031.jpg|thumb|The archangel of Saint Michael]] The reason why the revolts are referred to as “angelets” is unknown. One of the explanations advanced is the popular belief according to which the angels know the mountains well; another is the faculty that they have of appearing and disappearing.
As for the word ''“miquelets,”'' it refers primarily to Catalan mercenaries but sometimes to armed peasants. There is thus confusion among the ancient authors, particularly in relation to the war of Holland: They designate under the name “''miquelets''” all those who, in the province of Roussillon, oppose the king of France — though it be angelets or Catalan mercenaries in the service of the king of Spain.
[[Michael (archangel)|Archangel Michael]] is the patron saint of the miquelets and the wool-workers of [[Prats-de-Mollo-la-Preste|Prats-de-Mollo]], he who gave a sacred tint to one revolt that reclaimed liberties with the patriotic cry of ''“Visca la terra!”'' (“Long live the Land!”)
== Context ==
On May 8, 1659, the [[Reapers' War|Catalan Revolt]] came to an end, and on November 7, the [[Treaty of the Pyrenees]] was signed between the Spanish and the French monarchies. The agreement notably foresaw a sharing of the principality of Catalonia between the two sovereigns. The crown of France annexed five [[Comarques of Catalonia|comarques]] (corresponding to the two [[Counts]], minus lower Cerdanya and [[Llívia]]):
* the comarque of Roussillon * Vallespir * Conflent * [[Capcir]] * the burghs and villages of [[French Cerdagne]], that is the east of the count of Cerdagne
[[Louis XIV of France|Louis XIV]] engaged himself with respecting the local customs. But, since June 1660, he replaced Catalan institutions and agencies with his own political, judiciary, and fiscal structures. He created a sovereign Council at [[Perpignan]]. Then he named a steward.
Resistance to the new master began in March 1661. Having come to settle a disagreement between the inhabitants of [[Ayguatébia-Talau|Ayguatébia]] and those of [[Oreilla]], the viguier (magistrate) Marsal was violently attacked. He succeeded in escaping, but the notary and the domestic who accompanied him were killed. Immediately, the comarque of Conflent was subjected to a tax intended to pay the sometent français (the militia).
=== The Gabelle ===
The [[gabelle]], a tax on salt, had been abolished by the Catalan courts since the time of King [[James II of Majorca]], in 1283. In 1661, the French reestablished it. Its revenue was intended to finance the maintenance and construction of fortresses, as well as the payment of French functionaries. The measure was very unpopular. The king of France’s misuse of this tax’s revenue — to the detriment of Perpignan, which was only cashing an insignificant part of it — was considered an abjuration of the royal oath to respect the capital privileges of the comarque of Roussillon. The consuls of Perpignan protested. But the sovereign Council’s decision rejected the municipal complaint and imposed the will of the Louvre.
In Vallespir, a country of pastures, salt was necessary for feeding livestock and preserving meat. The inhabitants sent for it from the other side of the wholly new border. The tax made its price rise inordinately. In 1667, the peasants of Vallespir refused to pay it.
== The First Revolt (1667–68) ==
Smuggling was organized. The inspectors tracked down the traffickers in order to try to put an end to this activity. The peasants reacted, transforming themselves into veritable guerrilla fighters, harassing the French soldiers and especially the functionaries of the salt tax. An armed resistance was organized under the leadership of Joseph of Trinxeria, a merchant of Prats-de-Mollo.
The insurgents spread themselves in the county of Vallespir. In 1667, they hid in the villages of [[Serralongue]] and [[Montferrer]]. The following year, they attacked the hotel of [[Amélie-les-Bains-Palalda|Amélie-les-Bains]], where the tax collectors are housed. They besieged the deputy provost Maniel in the church of [[Saint-Laurent-de-Cerdans]]. The repression did not rest: eight inhabitants were condemned to death and 51 put into slavery. This did nothing to discourage the smugglers.
The president of the sovereign Council, the collaborator Francesc de Segarra, offered a reward of 100 gold ''doubles tournois'' (coins) to whoever would give information against the leaders of the resistance. On September 14, 1668, he left with 300 soldiers to make base at [[Arles]] in order to begin a harsh suppression. The punitive expedition was routed at Llop pass and had to retreat to Arles.
For several years, the rebels, knowing the terrain well, inflicted substantial losses on the French troops. From August 3, 1667 to June 30, 1668, they also pursued and eliminated a good number of salt tax inspectors.
The authorities of the salt tax resolved to negotiate: The armed struggle ceased and, in exchange, the townships of Vallespir could obtain smuggled salt. Through the “Compromise of [[Céret]],” the salt tax inspectors began to put an end to the controls and to coordinate with the council of each village, as to who would be charged from then on with the distribution of salt to the inhabitants.
== The Second Revolt (1670–74) ==
[[File:1674 - Plan bataille Maureillas.jpg|thumb|Battle plan near Maureillas in 1674]] In 1669, in Conflent, Joan Miquel Mestre, called “the Righteous Heir,” demanded a similar arrangement for [[Baillestavy]]. From September to November, he kept track of the customs officers. It was at that moment that the revolts were referred to under the name of “angelets.” Mestre was stopped by chance on the road from [[Camprodon]] on January 22, 1670 by the governor of Prats-de-Mollo. This set off a revolt on the part of the inhabitants, led by Josep de la Trinxeria and his lieutenant Damià Nohell, son of the mayor of Serralongue. They took the governor’s wife and children hostage and negotiated their release in return for that of the Righteous Heir. The exchange completed, the angelets returned via [[Tech (river)|the Tech]], seeing their troops grow to 1,500 men.
At this moment the revolt not only began again but also intensified considerably. The fighting stretched to all of Vallespir: On February 27, 1670, the insurgents seized Arles, from which they chased the garrison and killed the mayor. From March 31 to April 2, they besieged Céret, the capital of Vallespir.
The angelets held the high valley of Tech as well as Conflent. This was when the French sent an army of 4,000 soldiers. Avoiding offering an easy target on the route from the valley, they progressed through the mountains of Haut-Conflent that separated the two comarques, in order to take Vallespir from the rear. The technique of guerrilla warfare did not allow for maintaining a lined-up battle, on open terrain, facing a complete army: On May 5, the angelets were defeated at the Queen’s Pass, at the food of the Guillem Flat. Some took refuge in the principality of Catalonia; others hid in the mountains. The last bastion of the angelets having been defeated, the village of Py was sentenced to be razed. Salt had to be scattered over its ruins.
=== Beginnings of the War of Holland ===
Hostilities were revived by the [[Franco-Dutch War]] (1672–78), of which the Spanish front became one of the theaters. The struggle of the population then took the character of an anti-French uprising. The angelets collaborated with the Spanish monarchy (1673).
The village and church of Ayguatébia were burned by French troops on February 7, 1673.
The year 1674 was particularly difficult for the French, in the province of Roussillon. They would face conspiracies (Villefranche and Perpignan) and an entry of Spanish troops.
=== The Villefranche Conspiracy ===
The angelets were involved in the Villefranche Conspiracy, which aimed to reunite the Counties at the principality of Catalonia, on “Holy Saturday” in 1674.
The conspiracy was discovered. Its leader, Manuel Descatllar, was arrested. He was transferred to Perpignan where, under terrible torture, he confessed all his activities. He was executed in the square of [[La Loge, Pas-de-Calais|La Loge]] on April 20, 1674. As for his companion Francesc Puig i Terrats, he was condemned to death and had his throat cut in public, in front of his own house, on May 16. His body was quartered. The four parts of him were exhibited at four points in the city. Many other conspirators paid for their involvement through the loss of their civic and patrimonial rights.
=== Repression and End of the Revolt ===
The population was always in question. The king of Spain’s troops crossed the frontier and took the fort of Bellegarde (beginning 1674). They controlled a great part of the province (Cerdagne and Vallespir, a part of Roussillon and of Conflent) after they won the [[Battle of Maureillas]] over the French army on July. It was only in 1675 that the [[Frederick Schomberg, 1st Duke of Schomberg|Count of Schomberg]], taking advantage of the Spanish withdrawal of troops to face the recent [[Revolt of Messina]], took back Bellegarde and routed them once and for all.
The region was now overrun with the French troops. The repression reached the whole population: imprisonment, sentencing to the galleys, executions, confiscation of goods, and heavy fines imposed on the communes (that of Prats-de-Mollo was of 3,500 pounds, that of Saint-Laurent was of 1,600 pounds).
The revolt of the angelets was considered finished in 1675.
The hatreds were so exacerbated, and the cost of suppression was so high, that Louis XIV tried to exchange the Counties in return for Flanders. But [[Charles II of Spain]] refused.
The revolt being completely put out, the king of France renounced this exchange during negotiations of the [[Treaties of Nijmegen|Treaty of Nijmegen]], which put an end, in 1678, to the Franco-Dutch War.
{{Tax resistance}}

https://web.archive.org/web/20130512131526/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/prosecutor_to_seek_aggravated.html | archivedate = May 12, 2013 | df = mdy-all }}</ref> | victims = {{Plainlist| * Michelle Knight * Amanda Berry * Georgina "Gina" DeJesus }} | perp = {{Plainlist| * Ariel Castro }} }} The '''Ariel Castro kidnappings''' took place between 2002 and 2004 when three young women — Michelle Knight, Amanda Berry, and Georgina "Gina" DeJesus — were kidnapped by Ariel Castro and held captive in his home in the [[Tremont, Cleveland|Tremont]] neighborhood of [[Cleveland]], in the [[U.S. state]] of [[Ohio]]. They were subsequently imprisoned until May 6, 2013, when Berry escaped with her six-year-old daughter and contacted the police.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/frantic-911-call-leads-3-missing-women-ohio |title=Police Facing Questions in 3 Women's Ohio Rescue |last1=Sheeran |first1=Thomas |last2=Coyne |first2=John |date=May 7, 2013 |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20130515170424/http://bigstory.ap.org/article/frantic-911-call-leads-3-missing-women-ohio |archivedate=May 15, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22430145 |title=Three US women missing for years rescued in Ohio |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=BBC |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512163039/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22430145 |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=cnn050713>{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/06/us/ohio-missing-women-found/ |title=911 call – 'I've been kidnapped!' – cops find three women missing for year |last1=Almasy |first1=Steve |last2=Smith |first2=Matt |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6ZebQK?url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/06/us/ohio-missing-women-found/ |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news | last = Sherwell | first = Philip | date = May 7, 2013 | title = Ohio abductions: friendship between Ariel Castro's daughter and Gina DeJesus | newspaper = [[The Daily Telegraph]] | publisher = [[Telegraph Media Group]] | publication-place = London, England | url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10042659/Ohio-abductions-friendship-between-Ariel-Castros-daughter-and-Gina-DeJesus.html | accessdate = May 16, 2013 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130508025936/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10042659/Ohio-abductions-friendship-between-Ariel-Castros-daughter-and-Gina-DeJesus.html | archivedate = May 8, 2013 | df = mdy-all }}</ref> Knight and DeJesus were rescued by responding officers and Castro was arrested within hours.
On May 8, 2013, Castro was charged with four counts of [[kidnapping]] and three counts of [[rape]].<ref name="plain-dealer-charges">{{Cite news | last = Caniglia | first = John | last2 = Blackwell | first2 = Brandon | date = May 9, 2013 | title = Cleveland city prosecutors charge Ariel Castro with kidnapping, rape in case of missing women | newspaper = [[The Plain Dealer]] | publisher = Cleveland Live LLC, [[Advance Publications]] | publication-place = Cleveland, OH | url = http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/cleveland_city_prosecutors_cha.html#incart_river#incart_maj-story-1 | accessdate = May 16, 2013 | format = news article posted to Cleveland.com | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20130510123113/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/cleveland_city_prosecutors_cha.html#incart_river | archivedate = May 10, 2013 | df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/cleveland-kidnapping-suspect-ariel-castro-hid-dark-side/story?id=19122845 |title=Cleveland Kidnapping Suspect Ariel Castro Hid a Dark Side, His Uncle Says |last1=Perez |first1=Alex |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508090308/http://abcnews.go.com/US/cleveland-kidnapping-suspect-ariel-castro-hid-dark-side/story?id=19122845 |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Castro pleaded guilty to 937 criminal counts of rape, kidnapping, and [[Aggravation (law)|aggravated murder]] as part of a [[plea bargain]]. He was sentenced to life plus 1,000 years in prison without the possibility of parole.<ref name=usat072613>{{cite news |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/07/26/ariel-castro-cleveland-abduction-plea-deal-death-penalty/2589039/ |title=Ariel Castro pleads guilty in Ohio abductions |last1=Stanglin |first1=Doug |newspaper=USA Today |date=July 26, 2013 |accessdate=July 26, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130726170640/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/07/26/ariel-castro-cleveland-abduction-plea-deal-death-penalty/2589039/ |archivedate=July 26, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-ariel-castro-michelle-knight-20130801,0,2844274.story |last=Muskal |first=Michael |title=Ariel Castro gets life, no parole; victim says his hell awaits |publisher=latimes.com |accessdate=September 4, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130911223531/http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-ariel-castro-michelle-knight-20130801,0,2844274.story |archivedate=September 11, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> One month into his sentence, Castro committed suicide by hanging himself with bedsheets in his prison cell.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.10tv.com/content/stories/2013/09/04/Pickaway_Castro_Death.html |date=September 4, 2013 |publisher=10TV.com |title=Cleveland Kidnapper Ariel Castro Dead After Found Hanging In Prison Cell |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JNhWbTEq?url=http://www.10tv.com/content/stories/2013/09/04/Pickaway_Castro_Death.html |archivedate=September 4, 2013 |accessdate=September 4, 2013 |df=mdy }}</ref><ref name="suiciderpt"/>
==Perpetrator background== Ariel Castro was born on July 11, 1960, in [[Yauco, Puerto Rico|Yauco]], [[Puerto Rico]], to Pedro Castro and Lillian Rodriguez. When he was a child, his parents divorced. Shortly after the divorce, Castro moved to the [[contiguous United States|mainland]] with his mother and three siblings. The family first settled in [[Reading, Pennsylvania|Reading]], [[Pennsylvania]], and later moved to [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], where Castro's father and several other extended family members were living.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.latintimes.com/articles/4018/20130515/ariel-castro-relatives-puerto-rico-evil-demon-reading-cleveland.htm |title=Ariel Castro Relatives In Puerto Rico Say He Is 'Evil' And There Is 'Demon' Inside Him |last1=Creitz |first1=Charlie |date=May 15, 2013 |newspaper=Latin Times |accessdate=September 9, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131021044804/http://www.latintimes.com/articles/4018/20130515/ariel-castro-relatives-puerto-rico-evil-demon-reading-cleveland.htm |archivedate=October 21, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://articles.mcall.com/2013-05-10/news/mc-cleveland-kidnapping-suspect-pa-cousins-react-20130510_1_berks-county-berks-woman-brother |title=Cleveland kidnap suspect's Berks County cousins: 'This animal' shocked us |last1=Kelly |first1=Dan |last2=Urban |first2=Mike |date=May 10, 2013 |newspaper=The Morning Call |accessdate=September 9, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20130909145938/http://articles.mcall.com/2013-05-10/news/mc-cleveland-kidnapping-suspect-pa-cousins-react-20130510_1_berks-county-berks-woman-brother |archivedate=September 9, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://latino.foxnews.com/2013/05/08/relatives-cleveland-suspected-kidnappers-pioneered-city-latino-community/ |title=Relatives Of Cleveland's Suspected Kidnappers Pioneered The City's Latino Community |date=May 8, 2013 |publisher=Fox News Latino |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130615085125/http://latino.foxnews.com/2013/05/08/relatives-cleveland-suspected-kidnappers-pioneered-city-latino-community/ |archivedate=June 15, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/castro_family_among_first_hisp.html |title=Castro family among first Hispanics to settle in Cleveland, coming from Puerto Rico just after World War II |last1=O'Malley |first1=Michael |date=May 8, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=September 9, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130808225836/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/castro_family_among_first_hisp.html |archivedate=August 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Castro had nine siblings.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/discovery_of_amanda_berry_gina_1.html |title=Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus, Michelle Knight in Cleveland: Frequently asked questions |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510100357/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/discovery_of_amanda_berry_gina_1.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> According to Castro's uncle, his family knew the DeJesus family and had lived in the same West Cleveland neighborhood.<ref name=autogenerated4>{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/07/us/ohio-missing-women-found/ |title='I never forgot about you': Families reunite with women held captive for years |last1=Smith |first1=Matt |last2=Botelho |first2=Greg |last3=Savidge |first3=Martin |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512190405/http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/07/us/ohio-missing-women-found |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Castro was a 1979 graduate of Cleveland's [[Lincoln-West High School]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/13/castro-kidnapping-rape-cleveland/2155187/ |title=Details emerge on Cleveland kidnap suspect's history |last1=Leger |first1=Donna Leinwand |date=May 13, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 15, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130514084034/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/13/castro-kidnapping-rape-cleveland/2155187/ |archivedate=May 14, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/who-are-the-castro-brothers/article11780057/ |title=Who are the Castro brothers? |last1=Hui |first1=Ann |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Globe and Mail |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510111225/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/who-are-the-castro-brothers/article11780057/ |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Castro met his future girlfriend, Grimilda Figueroa, when his family moved into a house across the street from hers in the 1980s. They lived with both sets of parents, but moved into their own home at 2207 Seymour Avenue in 1992.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/08/us/ohio-missing-women-found/ |title=Ohio kidnapping case: Amanda Berry's baby delivered by another captive |last1=Botelho |first1=Greg |last2=Smith |first2=Matt |last3=Brown |first3=Pamela |date=May 9, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512191127/http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/08/us/ohio-missing-women-found |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=nationalpost1>{{cite web |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/05/09/ariel-castros-ex-wifes-family-allege-two-decade-campaign-of-violence/ |title=Ariel Castro's ex-wife's family allege two-decade campaign of violence |date=May 13, 2013 |newspaper=The Telegraph |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://wayback.archive-it.org/all/20130510170255/http://news.nationalpost.com/2013/05/09/ariel-castros-ex-wifes-family-allege-two-decade-campaign-of-violence/ |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Their home was a two-story, {{convert|1400|ft2|adj=on}}, four-bedroom, one-bathroom house with a {{convert|760|ft2|adj=on}} unfinished basement built in 1890 and remodeled in 1956.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/07/missing-women-cleveland-brothers-arrested/2140359/ |title=Reports of sex abuse, beatings inside Cleveland house |last1=Alcindor |first1=Yamiche |last2=Leger |first2=Donna Leinwand |last3=Johnson |first3=Kevin |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512203429/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/07/missing-women-cleveland-brothers-arrested/2140359/ |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=csm>{{cite web |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/USA-Update/2013/0508/Three-brothers-arrested-what-s-known-so-far-about-alleged-Cleveland-captors |title=Three brothers arrested: what's known so far about alleged Cleveland captors |last1=Terry |first1=Allison |date=May 8, 2013 |newspaper=The Christian Science Monitor |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508170911/http://www.csmonitor.com/USA/USA-Update/2013/0508/Three-brothers-arrested-what-s-known-so-far-about-alleged-Cleveland-captors |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/investigations/floor-plans-detail-inside-of-seymour-avenue-home-where-3-cleveland-women-held-captive-for-10-years |title=Floor plans detail inside of Seymour Avenue home where 3 Cleveland women held captive for 10+ years |last1=Regan |first1=Ron |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=newsnet5.com |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510110619/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/investigations/floor-plans-detail-inside-of-seymour-avenue-home-where-3-cleveland-women-held-captive-for-10-years |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> According to Figueroa's sister, Elida Caraballo, when the couple moved into their new home, "all hell started breaking loose". Caraballo and her husband Frank claim Castro beat Figueroa, breaking her nose, ribs, and arms. He also threw her down a flight of stairs, cracking her skull.<ref name="nationalpost1"/> In 1993, Castro was arrested for [[domestic violence]] but was not [[indictment|indicted]] by a [[grand jury]].<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/tv_station_reports_berry_dejes.html |title=Berry, DeJesus, Knight found alive, police source confirms |last1=Atassi |first1=Leila |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6GyIyu?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/tv_station_reports_berry_dejes.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Figueroa moved out of the home in 1996 and secured custody of her four children. Police assisted in the move and detained Castro, but did not pursue charges.<ref name="nationalpost1" /> Castro continued to threaten and attack Figueroa after she left him, according to Caraballo. A 2005 filing by Figueroa in [[Cuyahoga County, Ohio|Cuyahoga County]] [[Family court|Domestic Relations Court]] accused Castro of inflicting multiple severe injuries on her and of "frequently abduct[ing]" her daughters. A [[Injunction|temporary restraining order]] against Castro was granted, but was dismissed a few months later.<ref name="nationalpost1" /> Figueroa died in 2012 due to complications from a [[brain tumor]].<ref name="nationalpost1" />
Before his arrest at the age of 52,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://localtvwjw.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/documents.pdf|title=Request for High Bond|date=May 8, 2013|publisher=Cleveland Municipal Court Clerk of Courts Office|accessdate=May 13, 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130616082637/http://localtvwjw.files.wordpress.com/2013/05/documents.pdf|archivedate=June 16, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Castro worked as a bus driver for the [[Cleveland Metropolitan School District]] until he was fired for "bad judgment", including making an illegal [[U-turn]] with children on his bus,<ref name = autogenerated4 /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/20833 |title=Ariel Castro Arrested as Suspect in Abduction and Disappearance of Three Cleveland Women |last1=Kent |first1=Julie |date=May 6, 2013 |publisher=The Cleveland Leader |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130606212018/http://www.clevelandleader.com/node/20833 |archivedate=June 6, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> using his bus to go grocery shopping, leaving a child on the bus while he went for lunch, and leaving the bus unattended while he took a nap at home.<ref name=csm/> He was earning $18.91 per hour when he was discharged.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/ariel_castro_bus_driver_clevel.html |title=Ariel Castro fired as Cleveland school bus driver for leaving bus and going home "to rest" |last1=Starzyk |first1=Edith |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510122816/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/ariel_castro_bus_driver_clevel.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> At the time of his arrest, Castro's home was in [[foreclosure]] due to three years (2010–12) of unpaid [[property tax|real estate taxes]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/house_where_woman_held_captive.html |title=Cleveland house where missing women held captive is in foreclosure |last1=Sangiacomo |first1=Michael |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510123339/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/house_where_woman_held_captive.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==Kidnappings== [[File:2207 Seymour Ave.jpg|thumb|Castro's home at 2207 Seymour Avenue. It was demolished on August 7, 2013, as part of Castro's [[plea bargain]].]] All of Castro's victims were kidnapped after accepting a ride from Castro. He drove each to his home, lured them inside, took them to the basement, and restrained them.<ref name=cnn080213/><ref name="cleveland1">{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/initial_police_report_castro_t.html |title=Initial police report: Castro tempted women with rides, then abducted, beat and raped them |last1=Blackwell |first1=Brandon |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512214522/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/initial_police_report_castro_t.html |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=trib>{{cite news |author1=Palmer, Kim |author2=Gray, Kevin |lastauthoramp=yes |url=http://reuters.com/article/2013/05/09/ariel-castro-amanda-berry-gina-dejesus-idINDEE9470J620130509 |title=Cleveland kidnapping victims endured decade of isolation, rape, beatings |date=May 8, 2013 |agency=Reuters |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131005000346/http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/05/09/ariel-castro-amanda-berry-gina-dejesus-idINDEE9470J620130509 |archivedate=October 5, 2013 |df=mdy-all }} Also published by the ''Chicago Tribune'' as{{cite web |url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/chi-cleveland-kidnappings-20130508,0,4207182,full.story |title="Cleveland kidnappings: Victims endured years of rape, isolation, beatings" |accessdate=October 4, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509094000/http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/chi-cleveland-kidnappings-20130508%2C0%2C4207182%2Cfull.story |archivedate=May 9, 2013 |df=mdy }} .</ref> The house at 2207 Seymour Avenue, where they were held, was located in Cleveland's residential [[Tremont, Cleveland|Tremont]] neighborhood, where they had all disappeared.<ref name=newsnet5-found>{{cite web |url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/Cleveland-police-dispatch-Missing-teens-Amanda-Berry-and-Gina-DeJesus-found-alive |title=Cleveland police: Missing teens Amanda Berry and Gina DeJesus found alive, appear to be OK |last1=Steer |first1=Jen |date=May 6, 2013 |publisher=newsnet5.com |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512030233/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/Cleveland-police-dispatch-Missing-teens-Amanda-Berry-and-Gina-DeJesus-found-alive |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/key-events-ohio-missing-women-case |title=Key events in Ohio missing women case |date=May 7, 2013 |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130625172701/http://bigstory.ap.org/article/key-events-ohio-missing-women-case |archivedate=June 25, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/06/missing-women-ohio-found/2139873/ |title=3 brothers arrested as missing women found in Ohio |last1=Welch |first1=William |date=May 6, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130507080950/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/06/missing-women-ohio-found/2139873/ |archivedate=May 7, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://cleveland.cbslocal.com/2013/05/06/reports-amanda-berry-found-alive/ |title=Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus & Michele Knight Recovered From Tremont Home, Multiple People Arrested |last1=Harp |first1=Carl |date=May 6, 2013 |publisher=CBS Cleveland |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130517071209/http://cleveland.cbslocal.com/2013/05/06/reports-amanda-berry-found-alive/ |archivedate=May 17, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> It has since been demolished.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/video/cleveland-kidnapper-ariel-castros-house-destroyed-19891976 |title=Cleveland Kidnapper Ariel Castro |date=August 7, 2013 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=August 7, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130807152705/http://abcnews.go.com/US/video/cleveland-kidnapper-ariel-castros-house-destroyed-19891976 |archivedate=August 7, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===Michelle Knight=== Michelle Knight (born April 23, 1981) disappeared on August 23, 2002, after leaving a cousin's house.<ref name=pd050713>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_plagued_by_tro.html |title=Michelle Knight's 'normal teenage life,' plagued by troubles in years before disappearance |last1=Atassi |first1=Leila |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6Bph5C?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_plagued_by_tro.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> She was 21 years old at the time.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kpho.com/story/22184761/questions-still-remain-about-michelle-knights-disappearance |title=Questions still remain about Michelle Knight's disappearance |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=KPHO |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6DDqHI?url=http://www.kpho.com/story/22184761/questions-still-remain-about-michelle-knights-disappearance |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> On the day of her disappearance, she was scheduled to appear in court for a [[child custody]] case involving her son, who was in the custody of the state.<ref name=pd050713/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/09/michelle-knight-cleveland-abduction/2149003/ |title=Reports: Knight lived troubled life before abduction |last1=Eversley |first1=Melanie |last2=Alcindor |first2=Yamiche |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6EBJwz?url=http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/09/michelle-knight-cleveland-abduction/2149003/ |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Following Knight's rescue, police acknowledged that limited resources had been spent on investigating her disappearance, in part because she was an adult. Knight was believed to have run away voluntarily due to anger over losing custody of her son. According to Cleveland Deputy Police Chief Ed Tomba, she "was the focus of very few tips".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://usnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/05/07/18108362-police-acknowledge-little-focus-on-finding-michelle-knight-the-third-missing-cleveland-woman?lite |title=Police acknowledge little focus on finding Michelle Knight, the third missing Cleveland woman |last1=Johnson |first1=M. Alex |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=NBC News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6F13gS?url=http://usnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/05/07/18108362-police-acknowledge-little-focus-on-finding-michelle-knight-the-third-missing-cleveland-woman?lite |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Her removal from the [[National Crime Information Center]] database fifteen months after she disappeared has been criticized. [[Cleveland Division of Police|Cleveland Police]] and the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] maintain that her inclusion or exclusion had no bearing on her rescue.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_held_captive_f.html |title=Michelle Knight, held captive since 2002, removed by Cleveland police from FBI database 15 months after her disappearance |last1=Atassi |first1=Leila |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6GBBzy?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/michelle_knight_held_captive_f.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
===Amanda Berry=== Amanda Marie Berry (born April 22, 1986) disappeared on April 21, 2003, the day before her 17th birthday.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22433057 |title=Profile: Amanda Berry, Georgina DeJesus and Michele Knight |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=BBC |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6J4MVu?url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22433057 |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> She was last heard from when she called her sister to tell her that she was getting a ride home from her job at a [[Burger King]] at West 110th Street and [[Ohio State Route 10|Lorain Avenue]].<ref name= newsnet5-found /> The FBI initially considered Berry a [[Runaway (dependent)|runaway]] until a week after her disappearance, when an unidentified male used her cell phone to call her mother, saying, "I have Amanda. She's fine and will be coming home in a couple of days".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berrys_cell_phone_used.html |title=Amanda Berry's cell phone used a week after she went missing |last1=Guevara |first1=Damian |last2=Caniglia |first2=John |date=November 15, 2003 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6KYstD?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berrys_cell_phone_used.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/05/07/found-timeline-of-ohio-women-missing-since-2002/ |title=Found: Timeline of Ohio Women Missing Since 2002 |last1=Gray |first1=Madison |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=Time |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6LIBXd?url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2013/05/07/found-timeline-of-ohio-women-missing-since-2002/ |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Berry was featured in a 2004 segment of [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]'s ''[[America's Most Wanted]]'' (re-aired in 2005 and 2006), which linked her to Gina DeJesus, who by that point had also gone missing in Cleveland.<ref name=autogenerated3 /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=25773 |title=Amanda Berry |date=May 6, 2013 |publisher=America's Most Wanted |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510102825/http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=25773 |archivedate=May 10, 2013 }}</ref> Berry and DeJesus were profiled on ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'' and ''[[The Montel Williams Show]]'', where in 2004 self-proclaimed psychic [[Sylvia Browne]] told Berry's mother, Louwana Miller, that her daughter was dead and that she was "in water".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/story.aspx?storyid=26501 |title=Amanda Berry's mother asks Psychic Sylvia Browne 'Is she out there' |date=November 18, 2004 |publisher=WKYC |accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/daughter-found-women-missing-decade/story?id=19122795 |title=Kidnap Victim Amanda Berry Hailed as 'Real Hero' in Rescue of Three Women |last1=Goldman |first1=Russell |last2=Dolak |first2=Kevin |last3=Muir |first3=David |last4=Castellano |first4=Anthony |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=ABC News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508083940/http://abcnews.go.com/US/daughter-found-women-missing-decade/story?id=19122795 |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www2.macleans.ca/2013/05/07/psychic-on-the-montel-williams-show-said-amanda-berry-was-dead/ |title=Psychic on The Montel Williams Show said Amanda Berry was dead. She wasn't. |last1=Senger |first1=Emily |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=Maclean's |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513043608/http://www2.macleans.ca/2013/05/07/psychic-on-the-montel-williams-show-said-amanda-berry-was-dead/ |archivedate=May 13, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.oprah.com/oprahshow/Abductions-of-Amanda-Berry-Gina-DeJesus-and-Ashley-Summers-Video |title=The Abductions of Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus & Ashley Summers |date=October 12, 2009 |publisher=Oprah.com |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509012716/http://www.oprah.com/oprahshow/Abductions-of-Amanda-Berry-Gina-DeJesus-and-Ashley-Summers-Video |archivedate=May 9, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> This pronouncement devastated her mother, causing her to take down pictures and give away Berry's computer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berry_is_dead_psychic_t.html |title=Amanda Berry is dead, psychic tells her mother on Montel Williams' show |last1=Hudak |first1=Stephen |date=November 18, 2004 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510122659/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berry_is_dead_psychic_t.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> However, Miller continued to search for Berry until her death from [[heart failure]] in 2006.<ref name=autogenerated3>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2012/07/search_continues_for_amanda_be.html |title=Search continues for Amanda Berry's body on West Side of Cleveland |last1=Brown |first1=Doug |date=July 19, 2012 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6Mpq8D?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2012/07/search_continues_for_amanda_be.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berrys_mother_louwana_m.html |title=Amanda Berry's mother, Louwana Miller, dies without the answers she's sought for 3 years |last1=Guevara |first1=Damian G. |date=March 3, 2006 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510122710/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/amanda_berrys_mother_louwana_m.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> After Berry was found alive in 2013, Browne received criticism for the false declaration that Berry was dead.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/05/08/psychic-sylvia-brown-amanda-berry_n_3238316.html |title=Psychic Sylvia Browne Told Amanda Berry's Mother Her Daughter Was Dead In 2004 |last1=Sieczkowski |first1=Cavan |date=May 8, 2013 |publisher=The Huffington Post |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512132440/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/05/08/psychic-sylvia-brown-amanda-berry_n_3238316.html |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
In July 2012, Robert Wolford, a prison inmate who previously lived in Tremont, claimed to have information about the location of Berry's body and led police to an empty lot on Cleveland's West Side, where a fruitless search was conducted.<ref name=autogenerated3 /><ref name="3 missing women found">{{cite news |author1=Sheeran, Thomas J. |author2=Coyne, John |lastauthoramp=yes |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/2-women-missing-decade-found-alive-ohio |title=3 missing women found in Ohio, 3 brothers arrested |agency=Associated Press |date=May 7, 2013 |accessdate=May 14, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6azULh?url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/2-women-missing-decade-found-alive-ohio |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Wolford was sentenced in January 2013 to four-and-a-half years in prison for [[obstruction of justice]], [[making false statements|making a false report]], and making a false alarm.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/ohio-inmate-robert-wolford-gets-4-years-in-false-amanda-berry-search-tip |title=Ohio inmate Robert Wolford gets 4 years in false Amanda Berry search tip |date=January 16, 2013 |publisher=newsnet5.com |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130507132144/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/ohio-inmate-robert-wolford-gets-4-years-in-false-amanda-berry-search-tip |archivedate=May 7, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
On December 25, 2006, Berry gave birth to a daughter <!-- Please do not add the daughter's name, see talk page for more details. --> at 2207 Seymour Avenue.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10047663/Ohio-kidnappings-Michelle-Knight-forced-to-deliver-Amanda-Berrys-baby-on-Christmas-Day.html |title=Ohio kidnappings: Michelle Knight forced to deliver Amanda Berry's baby on Christmas Day |last1=Swaine |first1=Jon |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Telegraph |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511210935/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10047663/Ohio-kidnappings-Michelle-Knight-forced-to-deliver-Amanda-Berrys-baby-on-Christmas-Day.html |archivedate=May 11, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> DNA evidence has confirmed that Castro was the biological father of the child.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/ariel_castro_is_father_of_aman.html |title=Ariel Castro is father of Amanda Berry's child, state DNA results say |date=May 10, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130607110711/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/ariel_castro_is_father_of_aman.html |archivedate=June 7, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/298935/45/Investigator-Ariel-Castro-says-hes-cold-blooded |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130615084817/http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/298935/45/Investigator-Ariel-Castro-says-hes-cold-blooded |dead-url=yes |archive-date=June 15, 2013 |title=Investigator: Ariel Castro says he's "cold blooded" |last1=Meyer |first1=Tom |date=May 10, 2013 |publisher=WKYC |accessdate=May 13, 2013 }}</ref>
===Gina DeJesus=== [[Image:Gina-suspect-sketch.jpg|thumb|upright|right|180px|2004 FBI sketch of a suspect in DeJesus' disappearance]] Georgina "Gina" Lynn DeJesus (born February 13, 1990) went missing at age 14.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.cleveland.com/pdextra/2008/04/six_long_days_gina_still_missi.html |title=Six long days, Gina still missing Parents, police, city officials focus on case at community meeting |last1=Zicari |first1=Peter |date=April 1, 2008 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20130517194140/http://blog.cleveland.com/pdextra/2008/04/six_long_days_gina_still_missi.html |archivedate=May 17, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> She was last seen at a [[payphone]] at about 3 p.m. on April 2, 2004, on the way home from her [[middle school]] at West 105th Street and Lorain Avenue. DeJesus and her friend, Castro's daughter Arlene, had called Figueroa for permission to have a sleepover at DeJesus's house, but Figueroa replied they could not and the two girls parted ways.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/suspects_daughter_said_in_2004.html |title=Suspect's daughter said in 2004 she was the last to see Gina DeJesus |last1=Dissell |first1=Rachel |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6Vrz5i?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/suspects_daughter_said_in_2004.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Arlene was the last person to see DeJesus before her disappearance.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/cleveland-kidnapping-latest-police-twice-visited-house-in-ohio--but-missed-three-women-held-captive-for-a-decade-8605381.html |title=Cleveland kidnapping: Son reveals his father padlocked doors to basement because 'we weren't allowed to go there' |last1=Kumar |first1=Nikhil |last2=Usborne |first2=David |date=May 8, 2013 |newspaper=The Independent |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508011422/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/cleveland-kidnapping-latest-police-twice-visited-house-in-ohio--but-missed-three-women-held-captive-for-a-decade-8605381.html |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
DeJesus was taken under the impression that she was being dropped off, and trusted Castro because she was friends with his teenage daughter. Because no one witnessed DeJesus's abduction, an [[AMBER Alert]] was not issued, which angered DeJesus's father. He said in 2006, "The Amber Alert should work for any missing child … Whether it's an abduction or a runaway, a child needs to be found. We need to change this law".<ref name="3 missing women found"/>
A year after DeJesus' disappearance, the FBI released a [[composite sketch]] and description of a male suspect, described as "Latino, 25 to 35 years of age, {{convert|5|ft|10|in}}, {{convert|165|to|185|lb}}, with green eyes, a [[goatee]] and possibly a pencil-thin beard".<ref>{{cite web |last=Swaine |first=Jon |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10045464/Ohio-abductions-FBI-photofit-with-likeness-to-suspect-Ariel-Castro-held-for-seven-years-as-police-say-he-acted-alone.html |title=Ohio abductions: FBI photofit with likeness to suspect Ariel Castro held for seven years as police say he acted alone |publisher=Telegraph.co.uk |date=May 9, 2013 |accessdate=September 4, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608063305/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/10045464/Ohio-abductions-FBI-photofit-with-likeness-to-suspect-Ariel-Castro-held-for-seven-years-as-police-say-he-acted-alone.html |archivedate=June 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> According to court records, Castro was {{convert|5|ft|7|in}}, {{convert|179|lb}}; he had brown eyes and a goatee.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/story.aspx?storyid=33093 |title=Printout: FBI releases sketch of Gina DeJesus' alleged kidnapper |date=April 15, 2005 |publisher=WKYC |accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10882714 |title=FBI had sketch of suspect but missed the connection |date=May 10, 2013 |newspaper=The New Zealand Herald |accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref>
DeJesus was featured in the aforementioned ''America's Most Wanted'' segment, which linked her to Berry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=26744 |title=Gina DeJesus |date=May 6, 2013 |publisher=America's Most Wanted |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130609014439/http://www.amw.com/missing_children/case.cfm?id=26744 |archivedate=June 9, 2013 }}</ref> The disappearances received regular media attention over the years, continuing into 2012, while the families held public [[vigil]]s. Castro attended at least two of these vigils,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/video/542366/extended-interview-with-family-of-kidnapping-victim-gina-dejesus/ |title=Extended: Interview with Family of kidnapping victim Gina DeJesus |date=May 8, 2013 |publisher=Global News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509064743/http://globalnews.ca/video/542366/extended-interview-with-family-of-kidnapping-victim-gina-dejesus |archivedate=May 9, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.waff.com/story/22180697/dejesus-family-gina-knew-suspected-kidnapper-ariel-castro |title=Charges against Castro brothers expected soon |date=May 8, 2013 |publisher=WOIO |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130615043413/http://www.waff.com/story/22180697/dejesus-family-gina-knew-suspected-kidnapper-ariel-castro |archivedate=June 15, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> reportedly participated in a search party, and tried to get close to the DeJesus family.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/castro_family_connections_to_g.html |title=Castro family connections to Gina DeJesus and Amanda Berry investigations go back years |last1=Gomez |first1=Henry J. |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130607041714/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/castro_family_connections_to_g.html |archivedate=June 7, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> While a journalism student in 2004, Castro's son Anthony interviewed DeJesus's mother for an article about the disappearances in the ''Plain Press''.<ref name=autogenerated1 /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nhlink.net/plainpress/html/stories/2004-06/dejesusdisappearancechangesneighborhood.htm |title=Gina DeJesus' disappearance has changed her neighborhood |last1=Castro |first1=Ariel |date=June 2004 |publisher=Plain Press |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130515003552/http://www.nhlink.net/plainpress/html/stories/2004-06/dejesusdisappearancechangesneighborhood.htm |archivedate=May 15, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/07/castro-son-berry-dejesus/2140721/ |title=Suspect's son wrote article about missing Ohio teen |last1=Shookman |first1=Sara |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512212758/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/07/castro-son-berry-dejesus/2140721/ |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Police kept an active investigation open, offering a $25,000 reward for information.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.cleveland.com/pdextra/2008/04/new_search_for_gina_dejesus_co.html |title=New search for Gina DeJesus comes up empty Family's day is filled with anxiety, relief |last1=Baird |first1=Gabriel |date=April 1, 2008 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=http://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/20130508180459/http://blog.cleveland.com/pdextra/2008/04/new_search_for_gina_dejesus_co.html |archivedate=May 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2012/04/vigil_today_for_gina_dejesus_m.html |title=Vigil today for Gina DeJesus, missing for eight years |last1=Miller |first1=Donna J. |date=April 2, 2012 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203032139/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2012/04/vigil_today_for_gina_dejesus_m.html |archivedate=December 3, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==Captivity== After Knight's kidnapping, Castro took her upstairs, tied her hands and feet together, and pulled her up using her hands, feet, and neck. He left her there for three days without food. Prosecutors at Castro's sentencing wrote that diaries kept by the women "speak of forced sexual conduct, of being locked in a dark room, of anticipating the next session of abuse, of the dreams of someday escaping and being reunited with family, of being chained to a wall, of being held like a [[prisoner of war]], of missing the lives they once enjoyed, of [[Psychological abuse|emotional abuse]], of his threats to kill, of being treated like an animal, of continuous abuse, and of desiring freedom". The women were kept in locked upstairs bedrooms, where they were forced to use plastic toilets that were "emptied infrequently".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/07/ariel_castro_sentencing_memo_r.html |title=Ariel Castro sentencing memorandum filed by prosecutors |last1=Krouse |first1=Peter |date=July 31, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=August 6, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130804045034/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/07/ariel_castro_sentencing_memo_r.html |archivedate=August 4, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> They were fed one meal a day, and allowed to shower twice a week at most.<ref name=cnn080213>{{cite web |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/08/01/justice/ohio-cleveland-castro-home |title=Deception, threats and abuse: Captives' hellish life inside Castro's home |last1=Botelho |first1=Greg |date=August 2, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=August 6, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130805195802/http://www.cnn.com/2013/08/01/justice/ohio-cleveland-castro-home |archivedate=August 5, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
Knight told police that Castro had impregnated her at least five times, and had induced [[miscarriage]]s each time through beatings: hitting with [[dumbbell]]s, punching, and slamming her against walls. Starvation was also included.<ref name=trib/><ref name=cbs>{{cite web |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57583620/michelle-knight-told-cops-ariel-castro-threatened-to-kill-her-if-amanda-berrys-baby-died/ |title=Michelle Knight told cops Ariel Castro threatened to kill her if Amanda Berry's baby died |date=May 9, 2013 |publisher=CBS News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513001627/http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57583620/michelle-knight-told-cops-ariel-castro-threatened-to-kill-her-if-amanda-berrys-baby-died/ |archivedate=May 13, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Knight's grandmother told reporters that she would require [[Oral and maxillofacial surgery|facial reconstruction]] surgery due to the beatings she endured; she also lost hearing in one ear.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57583875/michelle-knight-needs-facial-reconstruction-after-cleveland-rescue-grandmother-says/ |title=Michelle Knight needs "facial reconstruction" after Cleveland rescue, grandmother says |date=May 10, 2013 |publisher=CBS News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6I10LA?url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57583875/michelle-knight-needs-facial-reconstruction-after-cleveland-rescue-grandmother-says/ |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> At one point, Knight had a pet dog while in captivity, but Castro killed the dog by snapping its neck after it bit him while trying to protect Knight.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/11/05/michelle-knight-dr-phil_n_4221776.html|title=Ariel Castro Used Barbell To Force Miscarriage: Michelle Knight|work=The Huffington Post|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131109060020/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/11/05/michelle-knight-dr-phil_n_4221776.html|archivedate=November 9, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> DeJesus told law enforcement she was raped but did not believe she was ever impregnated.<ref name=cbs />
In December 2006, Castro allegedly ordered Knight to assist in the birth of Berry's child, which took place in a small inflatable swimming pool, and threatened to kill Knight if the baby did not survive. At one point, the baby stopped breathing, but Knight was able to resuscitate her.<ref name=clbaby>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/authorities_say_daughter_of_am.html |title=Authorities say daughter of Amanda Berry born in inflatable pool |last1=Caniglia |first1=John |date=May 8, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510122911/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/authorities_say_daughter_of_am.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/police_report_michelle_knight.html |title=Police report: Michelle Knight revived Amanda Berry's baby just after birth |last1=Blackwell |first1=Brandon |date=May 9, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510100442/http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/police_report_michelle_knight.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Castro occasionally took the child out of the house, including to visit his mother; the girl called Castro "daddy" and Castro's mother "grandmother".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/08/ohio-missing-berry-dejesus-knight-castro/2143919/ |title=Latest revelations in Ohio captivity case |last1=Webb |first1=Robin |date=May 8, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512220227/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/08/ohio-missing-berry-dejesus-knight-castro/2143919/ |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/30_minutes_that_ended_a_decade.html |title=The rescue of Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus and Michelle Knight: 30 minutes that ended a decade of nightmares |last1=Gomez |first1=Henry J. |date=May 13, 2013 |newspaper=The Plain Dealer |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6Uwrmv?url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2013/05/30_minutes_that_ended_a_decade.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> In 2013, he showed one of his adult daughters a picture of the child and said that she was his girlfriend's daughter from another man. He had told others who saw her that she was his granddaughter.<ref name=clbaby/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/09/us/ohio-suspect-daughter/ |title='He is dead to me,' daughter of Ohio suspect says in CNN exclusive |last1=Segall |first1=Laura |last2=Fink |first2=Erica |last3=Brumfield |first3=Ben |date=May 10, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512205909/http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/09/us/ohio-suspect-daughter |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
According to a statement from Cleveland Police, officers visited Castro's home only once following the kidnappings to discuss an unrelated incident. Castro did not appear to be home at the time and was later interviewed elsewhere. Although neighbors claimed to have called the police about suspicious activity observed at the home, police have said they have no record of any such calls.<ref name="Police deny neighbors called about suspicious activity">{{cite web |author=Levs, Josh |url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/08/justice/ohio-police-investigation/index.html |title=Police deny neighbors called about suspicious activity at Castro home |date=May 8, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510040233/http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/08/justice/ohio-police-investigation/index.html |archivedate=May 10, 2013 |df=mdy-all }} Also published by WHNT as "[http://whnt.com/2013/05/08/ariel-castro-charged-with-kidnapping-rape-brothers-pedro-and-onil-released/ Ariel Castro Charged with Kidnapping, Rape; Brothers Pedro and Onil Released] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510155443/http://whnt.com/2013/05/08/ariel-castro-charged-with-kidnapping-rape-brothers-pedro-and-onil-released/ |date=May 10, 2013 }}".</ref> Castro's son Anthony reported that there were certain areas of the house that were inaccessible due to being locked.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://bigstory.ap.org/article/homeowner-where-3-women-were-found-was-no-stranger |title=In Ohio neighborhood, suspect was familiar figure |last1=Washington |first1=Jesse |date=May 7, 2013 |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130625072717/http://bigstory.ap.org/article/homeowner-where-3-women-were-found-was-no-stranger |archivedate=June 25, 2013 |df=mdy-all }} Also published by NewsNet5.com (WEWS-TV) as "[http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/family-friend-kidnapping-suspect-ariel-castro-was-friends-with-gina-dejesus-father-helped-search Family friend: Kidnapping suspect Ariel Castro was friends with Gina DeJesus' father, helped search] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510004908/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/cleveland_metro/family-friend-kidnapping-suspect-ariel-castro-was-friends-with-gina-dejesus-father-helped-search |date=May 10, 2013 }}"</ref> He also mentioned an occasion where, three weeks before the women's escape, Castro asked him if Berry would ever be found. Anthony said he told Castro that Berry was likely dead, to which Castro responded: "Really? You think so?"<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/kidnap-suspect-bizarre-question-son-article-1.1337753 |title=Main Cleveland kidnapping suspect's son says dad recently asked him whether one of the victims would be found |last1=Hutchinson |first1=Bill |date=May 7, 2013 |newspaper=New York Daily News |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130509234228/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/kidnap-suspect-bizarre-question-son-article-1.1337753 |archivedate=May 9, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
[[NBC]] affiliate [[WKYC]] reported that during Castro's interrogation, he recalled each of the three abductions in great detail and indicated that they were unplanned [[Crime of opportunity|crimes of opportunity]]. According to WKYC's sources, Castro did not have an "exit plan" and believed that he would eventually be caught. He referred to himself as "coldblooded" and a [[Sexual addiction|sex addict]].<ref name="USA Today 20130510">{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/10/ariel-castro-cleveland-abduction-cold-blood-kidnap/2149831/ |title=Ariel Castro to cops: 'I'm coldblooded' |last1=Meyer |first1=Tom |date=May 10, 2013 |newspaper=USA Today |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130512231813/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/10/ariel-castro-cleveland-abduction-cold-blood-kidnap/2149831/ |archivedate=May 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wkyc.com/video/default.aspx?bctid=2369153756001 |title=Investigator: Inside Ariel Castro's interrogation |publisher=WKYC |accessdate=September 4, 2013}}</ref> Police found a [[suicide note]] in Castro's home in which he allegedly discussed the abductions and wrote that his money, videos and possessions should be given to the kidnapped women if he were caught.<ref name="USA Today 20130510"/>
==Escape and rescue== On May 6, 2013, Berry was finally able to make contact with Castro's neighbors, leading to her escape with her 6-year-old daughter,<!-- Again, do not add the daughter's name, see talk page. --> and the rescue of DeJesus and Knight by authorities.<ref name= newsnet5-found/> According to police, when Castro left the house that day, Berry realized that he failed to lock the home's "big inside door", although the exterior storm door was bolted.<ref name="BBC Cleveland rescue">{{cite web|title=Cleveland rescue: The mystery of 2207 Seymour Avenue|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22446157|accessdate=May 14, 2013|publisher=BBC|date=May 10, 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130510102101/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-22446157|archivedate=May 10, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=McClam|first=Erin|title=Cleveland man charged with kidnapping, rape; no charges for 2 brothers|url=http://usnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/05/08/18123601-cleveland-man-charged-with-kidnapping-rape-no-charges-for-2-brothers?lite|accessdate=May 13, 2013|publisher=NBC News|date=May 9, 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513185729/http://usnews.nbcnews.com/_news/2013/05/08/18123601-cleveland-man-charged-with-kidnapping-rape-no-charges-for-2-brothers?lite|archivedate=May 13, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Martinez|first=Michael|title=As Ohio women remained in captivity, alleged abductor's life crumbled|url=http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/12/us/cleveland-abductions-narrative/index.html|accessdate=May 14, 2013|publisher=CNN|date=May 13, 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513104357/http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/12/us/cleveland-abductions-narrative/index.html|archivedate=May 13, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Alcindor|first1=Yamiche|title=Ariel Castro charged with kidnapping, rape of 3 Cleveland women|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/08/cleveland-kidnap-captured-chains-ropes/2143885/|accessdate=May 14, 2013|newspaper=USA Today|date=May 9, 2013|last2=Leger|first2=Donna Leinwand|last3=Strauss|first3=Gary|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513160304/http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2013/05/08/cleveland-kidnap-captured-chains-ropes/2143885/|archivedate=May 13, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> She did not attempt to break through the outer door because "she thought [Castro] was testing her", according to the police report. Previously, Castro tested the women by leaving the house partially unlocked and exits unsecured. If they attempted to escape, he beat them. Instead, Berry screamed for help when she saw neighbors through the screen.<ref name="BBC Cleveland rescue"/><ref>{{cite news|last=Mahoney|first=Jill|title=Death penalty possible for alleged Cleveland kidnapper, prosecutor says |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/kidnap-suspect-ariel-castro-due-in-cleveland-court/article11810618/|accessdate=May 14, 2013|newspaper=The Globe and Mail|date=May 10, 2013|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130615115016/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/kidnap-suspect-ariel-castro-due-in-cleveland-court/article11810618/|archivedate=June 15, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Dolan|first1=Matthew|title=Charges Filed in Abduction of Ohio Women|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424127887324059704578470750534634028|accessdate=May 14, 2013|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|date=May 9, 2013|last2=Barrett|first2=Joe|last3=El-Ghobashy|first3=Tamer|last4=Maher|first4=Kris|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151015195936/http://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424127887324059704578470750534634028|archivedate=October 15, 2015|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Meyer |first=Tom |title=Investigator: Amanda Berry delivered baby in plastic pool |url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/298772/45/Investigator-Read-details-of-captives-lives-escape |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130615114910/http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/298772/45/Investigator-Read-details-of-captives-lives-escape |dead-url=yes |archive-date=June 15, 2013 |accessdate=May 14, 2013 |publisher=WKYC |date=May 9, 2013 }}</ref>
Neighbor Angel Cordero responded to the screaming<ref name="slates">{{cite web |url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2013/05/08/_angel_cordero_cleveland_kidnapping_nobody_s_praising_the_less_flamboyant.html |title=Nobody's Praising Angel Cordero, the Less-Flamboyant Neighbor Who Also Helped Free Amanda Berry |last1=Levin |first1=Josh |date=May 8, 2013 |publisher=Slate |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Gk6Y2tgc?url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/the_slatest/2013/05/08/_angel_cordero_cleveland_kidnapping_nobody_s_praising_the_less_flamboyant.html |archivedate=May 19, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> but was unable to communicate with Berry, because he spoke little English. Another neighbor, Charles Ramsey, joined Cordero at the house's front door during the rescue.<ref>{{cite web|title=Charles Ramsey interview, rescuer of Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus and Michelle Knight in Cleveland|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=axCn04iXkBg|website=YouTube|publisher=News 5 Cleveland|accessdate=January 26, 2018|date=May 6, 2013|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180221202653/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=axCn04iXkBg|archivedate=February 21, 2018|df=mdy-all}}</ref> A hole was kicked through the bottom of the storm door, and Berry crawled through, carrying her daughter; Ramsey said Berry told him that she and her child were being kept inside the house against her will. Upon being freed, she went to the house of another Spanish-speaking neighbor<ref name="slates"/> and called [[9-1-1]], saying;
{{Reduced pull quote|1=center|width=92%|2=Help me, I've been kidnapped, and I've been missing for ten years. And I'm here. I'm free now!|3=Amanda Berry|4=call to 911.<ref name=cnn050713/><ref name="autogenerated8">{{cite web |url=http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2013/05/07/transcript-video-charles-ramsey-ac360-exclusive-invu/ |title=Anderson Cooper interview with Charles Ramsey |date=May 7, 2013 |publisher=CNN |accessdate=May 8, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608160414/http://cnnpressroom.blogs.cnn.com/2013/05/07/transcript-video-charles-ramsey-ac360-exclusive-invu/ |archivedate=June 8, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>}}
Responding police officers entered Castro's house. As they walked through an upstairs hallway with guns drawn, they announced themselves as Cleveland Police. After peeking out from a slightly opened bedroom door, Knight entered the hallway and leaped into an officer's arms, repeatedly saying, "You saved me."
